Entitlement, Abundant, Ample...Austere, adequate and abridged recovers Stupidity Video Talk Speaks Writes Signs Trust Loan Debt Asset Opportunity Potential Accredittion Certification Accomplishment Achievement Score Mark Grade Student School Opportunity Advantages Disadvantages Considerations Assessments Check Verify

PURPOSE.notes.1: This file is source.json for generating en.json, fr.json, mi.json etc.
PURPOSE.notes.2: Keys are stable identifiers; values are English anchors not used in apps.

USE.Compressed: Being text and highly repetitive, it compresses very well on the fly(gzip). Expected about 1/12th size.
USE.Latency: Expected, from AU to NZ (as an example): 0.08seconds. With a near CDN Edge (and HTTP/3/Brotli), drops to ~20–60 ms on a warm connection.

VALUE.Translation: Caching a common language file ensures translations are done once, reducing vendor cost.
VALUE.Consistency: All products draw from the same phrases, keeping terminology aligned across interfaces.
VALUE.Governance: Fixes and improvements flow globally from one master source, not piecemeal per team.
VALUE.Performance: Network cost is trivial; the true gain is lower translation cost and consistent wording, not speed.

INDUSTRIES.Media: Documents, artefacts, photos, social media posts.

BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE.PastParticiple: Marks completed state [gone]; may combine with auxiliaries [has gone].
BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE.NegativePast: States action did not occur [@S did not go].

BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE:PREFERENCES.notes.0: English often reuses forms [sent]; other languages separate them.
BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE:PREFERENCES.notes.1: Prefer PastParticiple when describing a state [has gone].
BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE:PREFERENCES.notes.2: Prefer Past when emphasising the act [went].
BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE:PREFERENCES.notes.3: Even if English form looks the same [sent], translation must still
BACKGROUND:LANGUAGE:PREFERENCES.notes.4: choose correctly so Māori, French, or Chinese produce right tense.

STRUCTURE.META: Describes wordgroup type [VERB,NOUN,VERB-BASED,NOUN-BASED] and optional RELATED/OPPOSITES.
STRUCTURE.VERB.TYPE: Classify verbs as Initiated (Teach/Start/Sell/Refund) or Experienced (Learn/Notice/Receive).
STRUCTURE.OBJECTS: Entity directly changed; locus of durable state [writing].
STRUCTURE.RECIPIENTS: Target or beneficiary; not always the state-holder [written to] (use [N/A] if none).
STRUCTURE.ACTIONS: Has subgroups: FORMS, PREDICATES, SENTENCES [write, wrote, writing, to write].
STRUCTURE.ACTIONS.FORMS: Has subgroups: ROOT, PAST, PRESENT_PARTICIPLE, PAST_PARTICIPLE, INFINITIVE.
STRUCTURE.ACTIONS.PREDICATES: Has subgroups: IMPERATIVE, INQUIRE, INFINITIVE, PROGRESSIVE, PAST, FUTURE, THIRD_PERSON_PRESENT, NEGATIVE_IMPERATIVE, NEGATIVE_PROGRESSIVE, NEGATIVE_PAST.
STRUCTURE.ITEMS: Enumerations [for COLOURS: red, blue, green, etc.].

STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.1: Tackling what belongs in ACTORS, OBJECTS, RECIPIENTS is possibly the hardest part.
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.2: While a better word may exist, derive each term from the wordgroup root.
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.3: For Purchase prefer Actor:!Purchasor, Object:Purchase, Recipient=[N/A].
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.4: For Teach prefer Actor:Teacher, Object:Teaching, Recipient:Taught.
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.5: Language-specific overrides can appear in comments [en:Submitter].
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.6: Model OBJECT as a noun record/state (registration, approval, refund, receipt).
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.7: If no clean noun exists, repoint OBJECT to a verb form via {{...}}; mark awkward words with leading ! and override per language.
STRUCTURE:PREFERENCES.notes.8: RECIPIENT may use the past-participial person-form from the same root (Refunded, Notified, Registered). Use [N/A] when no separate beneficiary exists.

FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.1: Handle stative and symmetric verbs. Some words (e.g. Belong, Meet) do not fit clean AGENT→RECIPIENT roles. Mark such cases explicitly.
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.2: Maintain an override map for irregular forms. Root→Agent and Root→Participle mappings fix awkward forms (e.g. Register→Registrar, Go→Gone).
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.3: Support multiple senses for polysemous roots. A single root like Register may need distinct sense tags for different uses.
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.4: Respect countability and invariants. Mark words that are uncountable (Evidence) or invariant in plural (Series, Fish).
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.5: Account for phrasal verbs and prepositions. Store optional particles so forms like Log in or Opt out are rendered correctly.
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.6: Provide locale and orthography overrides. Ensure NZ spelling (Enrol, Authorise) and macrons in Māori terms are enforced.
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.7: Support invariant or collective plurals. Add flags so collective nouns behave consistently across interfaces.
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.8: Plan for language families without participles. Allow RECIPIENTS overrides per language rather than forcing English forms.
FUTURE.CONSIDERATIONS.notes.9: Introduce governance tools. Supply a JSON Schema, a linter for placeholder refs and brackets, and a test harness that renders sample sentences to catch regressions.

TODO2.notes.1: Consider adding Health and Wellbeing terms not yet covered.
TODO2.notes.5: Identity and Authentication coverage beyond existing Accounts and Permissions.
TODO2.notes.7: Metrics and Assessment beyond existing Objectives and Grades.

CLEANUP.notes.1: Never truncate or lose data. Abort rather than return incomplete JSON.
CLEANUP.notes.3: Consider whether values under ACTORS are actually OBJECTS; move if necessary.
CLEANUP.notes.4: OBJECTS may repoint to verb forms only when the form names the state.
CLEANUP.notes.5: Use the durable-state rule: OBJECT holds the system’s changed state.

TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.Objective: Produce language-specific files with identical structure.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.Exclusions.keys: Never translate keys, or any value enclosed in square brackets (e.g. [META]).
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.Tokens: Do not translate @S, @O, {{...}}, or text after //. If /*...*/ comments are supported, do not translate them and strip at export.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.Redirection: Values may include {{ABSOLUTE.PATH}} references to other values; these must resolve to an existing key.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.Overrides: A value may include target-language overrides in comments: // [mi:Kupu] [fr:Texte]. Use exact or prefix match (e.g. mi-NZ -> mi).
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.DataQuality.value.redirection: List any unresolved {{...}} references at the end for correction.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.VALUE:STRIP: Strip comments after // after applying overrides.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.VALUE:CASE: Use sentence case. Capitalise first letter unless string begins with a token.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.VALUE:PUNCTUATION.INQUIRE_START: Begin all PREDICATES.INQUIRE and SENTENCES.INQUIRE with {{BASE.META.LANGUAGE.QUESTION_PREFIX}}.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.VALUE:PUNCTUATION.INQUIRE_END: End all PREDICATES.INQUIRE and SENTENCES.INQUIRE with {{BASE.META.LANGUAGE.QUESTION_SUFFIX}}.
TRANSLATION_INSTRUCTIONS.INSTRUCTIONS: In derived outputs, replace AI_INSTRUCTIONS with a note directing editors to make changes in source.json.

200.TITLE: OK
200.DESCRIPTION: The resource was found and returned.

201.[RELATED]: The default response from a POST operation. the 'location' header links to it.
201.TITLE: Created
201.INSTRUCTIONS: THe 'location' provides the url to the newly created resource.

202.TITLE: Accepted
202.DESCRIPTION: Operation request accepted but not prcessed yet.

401.TITLE: Unauthorised
401.DESCRIPTION: The server doesn't know which user you are.
401.INSTRUCTIONS: You need to sign up/in first (but there is no guarantee that you will have the required Permission)

402.TITLE: Payment Required
402.DESCRIPTION: The operation you requested requires an active up to date service subscription.

403.TITLE: Forbidden
403.DESCRIPTION: While Authenticated, the user account does not have sufficient permissions to be Authorised to perform this operation.
403.INSTRUCTIONS: Ask a responsible stakeholder to elevate the permissions granted to the user account.

404.TITLE: Not Found
404.DESCRIPTION: Resource (a fancy word for Page) not found! Sorry.

408.TITLE: Request Timeout
408.DESCRIPTION: Some network, proxy, device, service needs to hurry up or instruction needs to be smaller...
408.INSTRUCTIONS: It almost never works, but if you must, you could try again.

413.TITLE: Payload Too Large
413.DESCRIPTION: Just can't digest something that big...

500.TITLE: Internal (Server-Side) Error
500.DESCRIPTION: We're not exactly sure what happened, but our servers say something is wrong.

511.TITLE: Network Authentication Required
511.DESCRIPTION: The client needs to authenticate to gain network access.

000.TITLE: Offline
000.DESCRIPTION: Offline. When connected again, we could try again.
